ranked_diseases.explanation: Shortened QT interval is a hallmark feature of Short QT Syndrome, and paroxysmal atrial fibrillation is a common associated symptom.
Similar to Short QT Syndrome 1, this subtype also presents with a shortened QT interval and can include atrial fibrillation.
Another subtype of Short QT Syndrome with similar cardiac manifestations including shortened QT interval and atrial fibrillation.
While primarily associated with ventricular tachycardia, some cases may present with atrial fibrillation and QT interval abnormalities.
Although typically associated with ST-segment abnormalities, some cases may present with atrial fibrillation and altered QT intervals.
